body: correcting the foldername in oc_fscache works
files beginning with â€œãœâ€œ are not found by mirall and will be deleted on the client-folder.

please use our issue template as described in contribution. md.

betreff: [core] â€œãœâ€? in folder names (#1336) 
 
there is a problem if a foldername begins with the german letter â€žãœâ€œ

after uploading a folder sync failes and the letter is not shown in the webinterface (e.g. â€œãœbungenâ€? is shown as â€œbungenâ€?).

mirall is searching for â€œbungenâ€? but canâ€™t find it. on the filesystem it is stored correct.

â€”
reply to this email directly or view it on github.

i can't reproduce this problem with owncloud server 4.5.6 on linux with mysql database and syncing between windows client 1.2.0, linux client 1.1.4 and android app 1.3.18

creating, renaming, deleting, accessing or moving folders with ãœ as first letter works both locally and in the webinterface.

operating system: debian 6.0 squeeze
web server: apache 2
php version: 5.3.3
database: mysql 5.1.66
owncloud version: 4.5.6
(http://h2124669.stratoserver.net/phpinfo.php)

@ninjingames: how did you create the folder? creating folders in the webinterface works fine, but if you create them via csync/mirall the generation of correct fscache-rows fails. it also fails at the recreation after truncating the fscache-table

> creating folders in the webinterface works fine, but if you create them via csync/mirall the generation of correct fscache-rows fails.

could you test if it works with a "normal" webdav client?

@blaimi i've created a new folder in my shared directory on win7 called ãœbungen1 which was correctly synced to the server by the 1.2.0 windows client.
then i've created a new directory ãœbungen2 on my linux machine which was also correctly synced to the server by the 1.1.4 linux client (from the fedora 18 repo, which unfortunately still isn't updated to the latest 1.2.0 client).
i've made a third directory called ãœbungen3 via webinterface. all 3 directories were properly synced to all connected clients and they are correctly displayed as ãœbungen with the capital ãœ in the webinterface.

i've also moved some files in and out of the directories on the clients and the webinterface, renamed directories, deleted and recreated them and everything works as expected.

i'm also running the owncloud server on debian 6.0 squeeze, same versions for mysql, php and apache as you are. i've installed owncloud via the opensuse repo linked to from owncloud.com

this server is utf8! trust me ;)

after creating the folder â€œãœbungenâ€? via nautilusâ€™ webdav-interface, the folder was after a â€œf5â€? renamed to â€œbungenâ€? â†’ http: 404

please have a look at your admin screen within owncloud.
in case the correct locale is not available on your server or cannot be set you will see a warning.
alterntive: have a look at data/owncloud.log

![bildschirmfoto vom 2013-01-29 10:46:06](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1222379/106458/542db3a6-69f9-11e2-8eec-f5a72bfd5d6c.png)

no difference between creating per dav or webinterface. opening â€œwrongâ€? folders causes an error.

owncloud.log:
{"app":"core","message":"unable to rename, file is not writable : files\/â€¦\/bungen","level":3,"time":1359336570}

the file does not exist.

i'm pretty sure this is a locale issue. 
we change the local within our php code to en_us-utf8.
i  case the locale is not installed or named different umlauts will break.

please attach a screen shot if  your admin screen 
thx

i can reproduce this error. same problem here, with webdav and the mirall linux client.
if i upload the folder named ã–jendorf via webdav the ã– (umlaut) gets lost. 

i changed my language to deutsch (german) but the error is the same. 

the folder is added correctly in the filesystem: 

$ ls data/jan/files/ã–jendorf/

any ideas? how can i help to fix this?

i digged a bit around in the source and the database and found that it seems to be written wrong to the database:


mysql> select path,name from oc_fscache;
+--------------------------------+---------------------+
| path                                    | name                |
+--------------------------------+---------------------+
| /jan/files                              | files               | 
| /jan/files/flowpeaks-guide.pdf | flowpeaks-guide.pdf | 
| /jan/files/ã–jendorf            | jendorf             |
@codejunky what's your server environment?
@blaimi please attache a screenshot for your admin page within owncloud - thx

@deepdiver1975  my server environment is the following:

debian 6.0.4

$ php -v
php 5.3.3-7+squeeze9 with suhosin-patch (cli) (built: may  9 2012 07:20:37) 

$apache2 -version
server version: apache/2.2.16 (debian)

the client side is fedora 18

@codejunky thx please make sure the locale en_us.utf8 is installed.

please run:
````
$ more /etc/locale.gen | grep en_us

@deepdiver1975 yes. it is definetly a locale issue. the locale en_us is not installed on my server. i tried with another server which has en_us enabled and it works fine there.

maybe the installer should check whether the locale is available/installed? :-)

@codejunky have a look at your admin section - a clear warning is displayed.

for oc5 we will be a warning during installation.

@blaimi i'll give it one more try after that i'll close this issue as you are not responding to my questions and i cannot help you!

i've been asking you tree times already: have a look at the admin screen within owncloud!

https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/1336#issuecomment-13604722
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/1336#issuecomment-13346796
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/1336#issuecomment-12824175

as i already said in #1336-12815013, my server is on utf-8. this canâ€™t be a localization problem because that would affect the complete string and not only the first parts. it affects only \`oc_fscache\`.\`name\`â€“nothing else. and because \`oc_fscache\`.\`path\` contains the correct value, there must be a problem with â€œbasename()â€? in line 112 of filecache.php
![owncloud blaimi _20130215_230450](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1222379/162502/98eeb43c-77bd-11e2-8584-9d7223ddae1c.png)

my patch doesnâ€™t work :(

itâ€™s not the additional line, it was the enabled xdebug which made it work

i made a video for you. as you can see i was a bit confused in the second part, because a few minutes beforeâ€”iâ€™m sureâ€”the way with $globals didnâ€™t â€œcorrectâ€? the error

http://h2124669.stratoserver.net/umlauts.webm
@blaimi any news on your issue? to tell the truth i have no further idea on how to help you.

not yet. i have only very little spare time atm. iâ€™d like to test in on other machines with the same environment and same and different php-versions. maybe i can reproduce it and figure out whatâ€™s going on so i can file an upstream-bug-report to debian or php. i think the virtualization of the server is one of the main reasons. this would also explain the sporadic appearance.
@blaimi any news? thx
i could reproduce it on a fresh debian-squeeze setup in kvm (oc 4.5.7) but not yet figure out, whats the problem

really strange i am running debian squeeze with various owncloud versions without issues.

locales?â
